body_html: I think one concrete course of action that will probably work is to delete the symlink tools/shared/cwrap_common.py, and then do some sort of copy to fill it in (as I mentioned in #6386). The primary downside is that timestamp on the file would keep changing, but given that it's Python I don't think it should matter that much; at least, the Windows code suggests as much. @apaszke I don't know what you think about that, but I don't think it should cause too much trouble.

The primary downside is that timestamp on the file would keep changing, but given that it's Python I don't think it should matter that much; at least, the Windows code suggests as much. @apaszke I don't know what you think about that, but I don't think it should cause too much trouble.
body: I think one concrete course of action that will probably work is to delete the symlink `tools/shared/cwrap_common.py`, and then do some sort of copy to fill it in (as I mentioned in #6386). The primary downside is that timestamp on the file would keep changing, but given that it's Python I don't think it should matter that much; at least, the Windows code suggests as much. @apaszke I don't know what you think about that, but I don't think it should cause too much trouble.
